ygData.msgSnippet: ... Around L40, you start to run out of flowers to smell. ... No, the level system is limited, but not crippling.  What s crippling is Verant having nerfed
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 14 Dec 1999 silky@... wrote:
>
> I guess in my apparently inept way - I'm advising you to stop and smell the
> flowers. Value those around you a bit more - appreciate the little things
> that can make for a fuller experience.

Around L40, you start to run out of flowers to smell.

> That is the one fatal flaw EQ made that will probably forever keep it from
> being a true virtual world - the level system denotes an end.

No, the level system is limited, but not crippling. What's
crippling is Verant having nerfed anything resembling a trade
skill to the point where they're pointless, unprofitable, or
ineffective. That means the *only* way to achieve anything in
this game is via leveling. UO is way ahead of EQ on this
point (which in part is why UO has such different problems
than EQ, or EQ doesn't have some of the problems UO has if you
want to think of it that way).

--
